messages.title: THE BIG INTERVIEW - MILES BRIGGS
messages.content: Information about Miles Briggs and his connection to the local area, including his aspirations and reasons for standing as an MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Mentions the need for a new secondary school for the local pupils.
Focuses on supporting businesses locally and attracting new firms.
Addresses the need to reverse cutbacks at St Andrews Community Hospital and the lack of a new care home in Newburgh.
Talks about reversing Territorial Army funding cuts.
Encourages the backing of local traders.
Campaigns to safeguard retained fire stations.

issues.economy: Supporting local businesses and attracting new firms to the region.
issues.education: Advocating for a new secondary school.
issues.governance: Addressing issues with the Governance of St Andrews Community Hospital and the lack of a new care home.
issues.health: Reversing funding cuts and addressing healthcare issues in Newburgh.

housing.content: Lack of a new care home in Newburgh.

leaflet.personalStatement: Details about why Miles Briggs wants to be an MP and his connection to the area.

images.caption: Miles Briggs pictured in the local area.
Miles Briggs with two other people, possibly constituents or supporters.
Campaign image with the words 'READY FOR CHANGE'.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes several headlines from local newspapers involving Miles Briggs and issues like TA funding cuts, new care home, backing local traders, and fire station safeguarding.
